comments: I feel this may be related to bug 56182 but there are significant differences. Essentially using FC1 with the j2sdk1.4.2_04 the "Run Garbage Collection" doesn't actually collect any garbage. I discovered this in section 1.0 of the "An Introduction in Profiling Java Applications" tutorial. I've altered the code slightly to make the bug easier to see. Essentially after creating a group of unreferenced objects any attempt to click the garbage collection button merely spawns another thread. These threads just pile up but never seem to actually do anything and never terminate on their own, all uncollected objects (if there are any) are left untouched. It is possible this may be a bug in the jvm as the specification for System.gc() reads "Calling the gc method suggests that the Java Virtual Machine expend effort toward recycling unused objects in order to make the memory they currently occupy available for quick reuse". I interpret this to mean that a garbage collection thread has been spawned with that purpose but with no garuntee as to when it runs or to its success in finding the unreferenced objects. On the other hand making a call to System.gc() within the code itself will not only collect all the unreferenced objects but will clear up any threads left running by the garbage collection button. I'll attach my altered code

Okay I'm not sure if this entirely the same bug but seems like it may be
related, it will launch java applications by themselves just fine but I've I try
to launch one in the profiler I get two errors, the first is 

"IWAT0113E Error launching application.  Reason: IWAT0014E Configuration error
on Agent Controller.  Error exists in Agent Controller configuration file:
serviceconfig.xml Make sure the Agent Controller installation is correctly
configured."  

I havn't touched any of those files nor did the error come up before this.  The
next error to come up is,

"IWAT0008E Error launching JCarModel

Reason:
IWAT00071 Either the Agent Controller (RAServer.exe) is not started, or the Java
path is incorrect.  See log for more details."

RAServer is running and has been running a while including several uses of the
profiler under 1.3 and 3.0.  It is after attempting to run the program under the
profiler that I get these errors and only when trying to quit afterwards that
the null pointer pops up.  Again I can't be sure this is the same bug but it
seemed like it could be related as it poped up immediatly afterwards so I
figgured I'd report it along with the first incase there was a connection.  When
I tried running with 1.3 (eclipse 2.1.3), I got the first error (but not the
second) then when I quit the first time this message came up
"
 ./eclipse -vm /usr/java/j2sdk1.4.2_04/bin/java
Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Reason:
Widget is disposed
"
the next two times I ran it the message didn't come up though I still got the
first popup error when I tried to launch JCarModel (the null pointer showed up
every time with the 3.0).

I suspect it has something to do with the running instance of the RAServer and
this was a bug that was caught in 1.3/2.1.3 but reopened in 3.0/3.0.  Again I'm
sorry if these are seperate bugs as I suspect they might be, I've tried to
include as much info as I could

Restarting the RAServer has stopped the null pointer but the garbage collection
bug continues

I would like to address this now but the priority is too low for 3.0.  We will 
address this early next release
